definition: to transmit an order
biography/historical narrative/commentaries/relay station
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
classifier for a ream of paper
see 令狐[Ling2 hu2]
see 脊令[ji2 ling2]
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
(military) messenger/orderly

sentences.english: No heralds, however, came down to inform the town.
sentences.chinese: 然而，沒有傳令官來通知這個城鎮。

sentences.english: And only herald to the gaudy spring.
sentences.chinese: 還只是喧鬧春天的傳令兵。
軍士麥考夫是我的傳令兵。

sentences.english: Sun Fei-hu gave orders to his men to retreat to the distance required and pitch tents there.
sentences.chinese: 一面孫飛虎傳令賊衆後退一箭之地，紮下營帳。

sentences.english: The general's orderly delivered the message.
sentences.chinese: 將軍的傳令兵傳送了這一消息。

sentences.english: A herald will proclaim the new king immediately the old one dies.
sentences.chinese: 傳令官將在老國王去世後立刻宣告新國王。

sentences.english: It ought to be a "batman" spring breeze.
sentences.chinese: 春風大概是個“傳令兵”吧。

sentences.english: In the middle of the night the drums suddenly beat to arms.
sentences.chinese: 半夜裏突然戰鼓鳴，傳令準備戰鬥。

sentences.english: Sui Ling so that troops and horses concentrated, sub-East and West along the beach location.
sentences.chinese: 遂傳令兵馬集中，分東西二路沿海灘選址。

sentences.english: Soon after going abroad with the army he was mentioned in despatches.
sentences.chinese: 他隨部隊出國後不久便得到傳令嘉獎。

sentences.english: After running such a long way, the messenger was gasping for breath.
sentences.chinese: 傳令兵在跑了這麼長一段路後，直喘粗氣。

sentences.english: When Brass Herald comes into play, reveal the top four cards of your library.
sentences.chinese: 當黃銅傳令使進場時，展示你牌庫頂上的四張牌。

definition: to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
to dispatch troops/to send an army/to mobilize forces
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
kitchen/cook/chef
overjoyed at unexpected good news (idiom)
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to collapse/to topple/to capsize
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
Suiyang district of Shangqiu city 商丘市[Shang1 qiu1 shi4], Henan
